bibl.title: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, June 29, 1940

div1.p: Clemons offers, as a gift, copies of the Kean and Moran letters, which are on file at the University of Virginia Alderman Library.

div1.head: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, June 29, 1940
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
CHARLOTTESVILLE
ALDERMAN LIBRARY
29 June 1940
HARRY CLEMONS
LIBRARIAN
MARY LOUISE DINWIDDIE
ASSISTANT LIBRARIAN
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
We are glad to let you have the
photoprint copies which you took with you of the
Kean and Moran letters, and we have followed your
suggestion in having new photoprints made for our
files. Mr. Wyllie and I should both be glad if you
would accept those copies as a gift. But if, as
your letter suggests, such acceptance means embar-
rassment for you, we can state that the regular charge
would be $2.10--and the embarrassment thus becomes
ours! At any rate we are delighted in being able to
help in any way in this undertaking.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Harry Clemons
Librarian To Dr. Philip S. Hench
102-110 Second Avenue, S. W.
Rochester, Minnesota
